meanings.definition: To serve as a means to achieve a particular end.
meanings.sent1: Her dedication subserved the success of the project.
meanings.sent2: The tools subserved the completion of the task.
meanings.sent3: His positive attitude subserved the team's morale.
meanings.sent4: The key information subserved the decision-making process.
meanings.sent5: The map subserved our journey by guiding us accurately.

meanings.definition: To be helpful or useful in achieving a goal.
meanings.sent1: The new software subserved the efficiency of the company.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise subserved his health goals.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella subserved its purpose during the sudden rain.
meanings.sent4: Her advice subserved his career growth significantly.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight subserved our search in the dark cave.
